justification: “Participants made decisions about apparent motion in random dot kinematograms … which is a standard task in decision-making studies.”

measured_by: ‘a’ decision-threshold parameter of the diffusion model
justification: “Regarding the specific parameters of the model, a refers to the distance between the decision thresholds.”

measured_by: ‘v’ drift-rate parameter of the diffusion model
‘z’ starting-point parameter of the diffusion model
‘ter’ non-decision-time parameter of the diffusion model
‘s_v’ variability parameter of the diffusion model
justification: “s v refers to the between-trial variability in drift rate.”

measured_by: number of correct responses per unit time
justification: “Reward rate is the expected number of correct decisions that can be made in some time period, or equivalently, the expected time between correct decisions.”
